posts._title: Pedro Almodóvar – Laberinto de pasiones aka Labyrinth of Passion (1982)
posts.title: Laberinto de pasiones
posts.excerpt: A camp melodrama/comedy about Sexilia (a nymphomaniac), Sadec (a gay Islamic terrorist), Riza Niro (the son of the emperor of Tiran), and Queti (the daughter of a dry-cleaner). When Riza Niro discovers that Sadec and his colleagues are after him, he disguises himself as a punk rocker, and falls in love with the stunning Sexilia, …

posts.title: Salomé
posts.excerpt: From Almodovarlandia.com: As Almodóvar had already tried out different durations in Super 8, he decided to shoot a film in a greater format, in 16 mm. In Salomé the origin of veil is being dealt with. Abraham is walking across the countryside together with his son Isaac and meets Salomé, who is fully covered with …

posts.title: Partisan
posts.excerpt: Content: It is about the members of the “Partisan” organization for physical education doing gymnastics. Reception and accompaniment of Tito’s (estafette?) baton is also presented. Movie from 1953, in duration of 11 minutes. The movie is created in standard technique, with sound, in black and white

posts._title: Marco Ferreri – Storia di Piera AKA The Story of Piera (1983)
posts.title: Storia di Piera
posts.excerpt: Plot Synopsis from allmovie.com by Eleanor Mannikka This sometimes confusing erotic drama about the incestuous relationship of a mother and daughter is based on the autobiography of Italian theater actress Piera Degli Esposti though it focuses more on her mother Eugenia (Hanna Schygulla). The liberated Eugenia and her spaced-out, husband (Marcello Mastroianni) — a professor …

posts.title: The Entity
posts.excerpt: This big budget entry from the early ’80s horror boom is one of the most underrated of that genre. The Entity succeeds despite potentially exploitative subject matter because it tells its story in a serious, respectful style. Frank de Felitta’s script devotes as much time to building three-dimensional characters and detailing the inner workings of …

posts._title: Abram Room – Tretya Meshchanskaya AKA Bed And Sofa (1927)
posts.title: Tretya Meshchanskaya
posts.excerpt: A married couple have a small apartment in Moscow. When an old friend of the husband’s arrives in the city, he is unable to find lodgings. Kolia, the husband, invites his friend to move in with them. While Kolia is away on business, sensual Liuda and attractive Volodia fall in love and have an affair. …

posts._title: Abé Mark Nornes – Japanese Documentary Film: The Meiji Era through Hiroshima (2003)
posts.title: Japanese Documentary Film: The Meiji Era through Hiroshima
posts.excerpt: Quote: Among Asian countries-where until recently documentary filmmaking was largely the domain of central governments-Japan was exceptional for the vigor of its nonfiction film industry. And yet, for all its aesthetic, historical, and political interest, the Japanese documentary remains little known and largely unstudied outside of Japan. This is the first English-language study of the …

posts._title: Benoît Jacquot – Au fond des bois (2010)
posts.title: Au fond des bois
posts.excerpt: Inspired by a true story, this atmospheric drama set in 1865 explores the ability of passion to overcome one’s sense of self as young beauty Josephine’s (Isild Le Besco) comfortable life is thrown into chaos by the hypnotic presence of a wild vagabond named Timothee (Nahuel Pérez Biscayart). After Timothee assaults her, Josephine flees with …

posts._title: Jean-Jacques Jauffret – Après le sud AKA Heat Wave (2011)
posts.title: Après le sud
posts.excerpt: A modern drama freely based on real events. One sweltering afternoon in the south of France, four lives intersect: those of Stéphane and Luigi, two cousins barely out of adolescence, Georges, a retired worker, Amelie, Luigi’s girlfriend, and Anne, Amelie’s mother. Four mundane lives full of hurts, humiliations, fears and fatigue which converge on a …

posts._title: Krzysztof Zanussi – Zycie jako smiertelna choroba przenoszona droga plciowa AKA Life As a Fatal Sexually Transmitted Disease (2000)
posts.title: Zycie jako smiertelna choroba przenoszona droga plciowa
posts.excerpt: (From filmref.com) In early 12th century France, a horse thief is captured in the outskirts of a peasant village and brought to the attention of a passing monk in order to receive absolution before being hanged for his crime. Momentarily released from his binding in order to pray, the thief seizes the opportunity to flee …
